parameters: "Unfortunately, you've come at a bad time..."
"You see, our town is under attack by minions."
"The Dragon King rules over 6 beastly races."
"The Goblins are our main priority right now."
You should probably pick up a class at the inn, though.
It's to the east, near the equipment shop.
"Kill a single Goblin, and we'll talk..."
"Now, a test: here is the map to the Orc Camp."
"Kill 10 Orcs for me and report back."
"You should probably take one at a time..."
"Take a rest at your house first."
"Oh, and remember to check out the shops."
"Well? Did you actually gain some courage now?"
"I will let them join our fighting force."
"BUT THEY ARE NOT ALLOWED IN OUR TOWN!"
"I will send troops to protect them."
"But only if they prove themselves in combat."
"Perhaps we can use your... diplomacy here"
"Try to find an Orc that will hear you out."
"Here is the map to their camp."
"Very good! Now, a new task for you..."
"Go to their camp and kill about... 15."
"Once the fight starts, it will not stop."
"That is, until you kill enough of them."
"Oh, and see if you can get some potions."
"Check the shop closest to the gate."
You return to the Mayor and tell him what Sam requested.
"Wants us to recruit the other races?"
"You may be a good diplomat, but..."
"Minotaurs are FIERCELY loyal to the Dragon."
"Tread carefully or we lose half our army!"
"Next, I'll be sending you to the Slimes."
"I just so happen to have a map to there."
"And, yes, I know what you're thinking..."
"But if we have to persuade every race..."
"Here's the map to where they live."
You weren't thinking about how Slimes were disgusting.
In fact, you've always been very curious of other races.
You take the map and head out.
"By the sheer amount of goop covering you..."
"I'd say you killed those Slimes pretty good!"
"Now we get to the REAL challenges, ahaha!"
"You'll want to have a good head for this one."
"The Harpies' nest is your next target."
"They're even worse than Orcs, so be warned!"
"We're past the halfway point, keep it up!"
You return to the Mayor and attempt to persuade him.
He doesn't take well to the Slimes' terms.
"COOKING AND FARMING? AND ENTERING MY TOWN?"
"...On the other hand, you have my hands tied."
"If we lose the Slimes, we lose the others."
"Fine, they can enter. BUT only with a permit!"
"AND they must be gone before dusk."
"In case they don't follow these rules."
"Anyway, one of my men will be sent to them."
"This one to do with those feathery freaks.
"I'm of course talking about the harpies."
"You need to be prepared to face the Dragon."
"Welcome back! You look... pretty messed up."
"The lair is surrounded by a magical shield."
"Recover the 2 pieces from killing their kind."
"We will then be able to reforge the seal..."
"And it will be time to face the Dragon!"
"Here's the map to their main camp."
"Be swift and true... and come back alive."
You return to the Mayor, the question still on your mind.
You explain that the Harpies have agreed to join your side.
After you finish, you mention what Polly said.
"I am SHOCKED you brought this up."
"Don't worry, my friend, I am a fair leader."
"...But now, let's continue to the final race."
"The Minotaurs are very close to the Dragon"
"You will need to convince one of them."
"We have arranged for you to meet with one."
The Mayor hands you a raw steak, with a ribbon tied to it.
You take it, but you don't think it will help...
If anything, it may actually hurt your diplomacy.
Minotaurs aren't beasts, they're highly intelligent.
Also, being half bull... a steak doesn't feel right.
Even if they COULD eat it, as they're all herbivores.
You put it into your pack anyway.
Perhaps it will come in handy sometime.
You return to the Mayor and inform him of your slaughter.
You present to him the seal fragments.
"Amazing! You actually managed to defeat them!"
"Your final task is to face the Dragon."
"He is ten times worse than any enemy before."
"Rest up, buy some potions and gear, and go."
He fits the pieces together and they magically fuse.
He gives the finished seal to you, as well as a map.
He nods at you. You nod back. It is time.
"Come back when you have both Seal Fragments!"
You return to the Mayor with your nerves tensed.
You feel butterflies as you step toward him.
He clearly notices this, and hands you some wine.
His face is that of concern.
"Are we going to lose all progress we've made?"
You take a sip of wine to clear your head, breathing deeply.
Then, you repeat what you agreed on with Jake.
The Mayor's face went from concern to anger to utter rage.
He swings his fist at you, but you dodge the blow.
You put your hand to your weapon in case of confrontation.
Your gaze stays on the Mayor as you try to deescalate.
Eventually the Mayor is calm enough to sit back down.
You try to reason with him about peace between the two.
"I will be sending troops after him soon."
"Hurry over there if you want to talk..."
"...Before they arrive and destroy the beast!"
*Keeps laughing as you back out of the room.*
As you leave, a guard hurries out after you.
He silently hands you a map, putting his finger to his lips.
You nod, and he runs back to his stand before he's seen.
You return to the Mayor with a determined look on your face.
Showing him the seal, you explain what happened.
He smirks and starts to slowly clap, sauntering up to you.
He puts his arm around your shoulder.
"I knew you would see the truth."
"You'll need some gear to face the Dragon."
"Here, take these. I had it specially crafted."
"I was sure you would come around eventually."
He hands you a pack full of gear and potions.
He then hands you the Dragon's Camp map.
You're sent on your way, feeling a little guilty.
However, what's done is done and it's time to fight.
You return to the Mayor still weary from the battle.
There's something... different about him, though.
He seems to glow with an odd purplish color.
His grin is massive, and is the last thing you see before...
"You have no idea what you've done, 'hero!'"
"Now, the time has come! Pledge yourself..."
You feel his power radiating off his monstrous body.
You bow to him in defeat.
"Good, good! Now, watch as the entire town..."
When you awake, the town is in ruins.
You need to figure out a plan...
Maybe something here will help you?
You reach the Mayor's office and burst through the doors.
You face the Mayor and draw your sword.
His face goes pale and fills with fear.
He hastily gets up and shouts to you.
"I'm not and have never been a fighter!"
"What do you want!? I'll give it all!"
"I'll do whatever you say, just don't hurt me!"
"Coward! You hide behind heroes and guards!"
"Would be able to live as long as you have!"
"Uh... why, yes, I'm a demon worshipper."
"I made a pact with, uh, Nebula..."
"Is that why you went after us!?"
"As some... offering to your sick demon god!?"
"You disgust me! I say off with his head!"
"Wait! But if we kill him, are we any better?"
"Most pacts can be broken, with consequences."
"They want pure souls, not marred ones."
"And I'm sure if it gets too harsh..."
"We can find someone who can cure curses!"
"I will reform! I'll take the curse!"
You ponder it a moment, then sheathe your sword.
You then walk up to the Mayor...
And punch him in the face before walking away.
*No one notices his smirk as they exit*
Perhaps it is time to get to know the other races.
The Dragon King may be too busy, but the others?
Willow, Sam, Gate, Polly, and Jake?
You decide to pay them all a visit.
"DID YOU NOT HEAR ME THE FIRST TIME?"
"KILL SOME FREAKING GOBLINS OR I'LL HANG YOU!"
You back away slowly and venture out again towards the camp.
"Good job, you killed a weak, sickly Goblin."
Would you like to change your class?
Where would you like to go?
...Wait, it seems you haven't spoken with the Mayor yet!
Come back after you have the first map.
You've really made a name for yourself as a romantic.
It's been a year of ups and downs, but overall peace-times.
However, you haven't really seen or heard anything from...
The Dragon King. You decide to check on him now.
You wake up to a sound in the middle of the night.
The moon is red as blood, a phenomenon with a fit name:
Blood Moon. It happens once every year. You sit up.
Staring out your window, you admire the peace and quiet...
Wait, peace and quiet? The town is NEVER quiet.
It was always hustle and bustle, at ALL times of day.
Something was wrong. You get out of bed and dress yourself.
You make your way quietly into the streets.
No one is there. Not a single human or animal.
You knock on some doors. Nothing. Complete stillness.
What in the world is going on? Is this a dream?
No, it's very much real, and terrifying!
You rush to the stables, but your horse isn't there!
No horses are there, in fact! How are you going to get help?
As you search for any sort of answer, you hear flapping.
Polly is frantically flying toward the town.
You are needed in the forest!
Have your weapon and armor? Good, now come!
